meanings.definition: relating to or denoting a plant or animal that is produced asexually from one ancestor or stock
meanings.sent1: The clonal plants in the garden all looked exactly the same.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the clonal reproduction of the bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The clonal flowers seemed to be copying each other's colors.
meanings.sent4: The clonal army of ants marched in perfect unison.
meanings.sent5: The clonal trees formed a beautiful symmetrical pattern in the forest.

meanings.definition: a group of genetically identical individuals derived from a single ancestor
meanings.sent1: The clonal of bees worked together harmoniously in the hive.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was amazed by the large clonal of sheep in the field.
meanings.sent3: The clonal of ducks waddled in a perfectly synchronized line.
meanings.sent4: The clonal of students all aced the test with identical scores.
meanings.sent5: The clonal of mushrooms spread across the forest floor like a carpet.
